dc_title_s: Johnson's California, territories of New Mexico and Utah / by Johnson & Browning.
dc_description_s: Relief shown by hachures, spot heights, and bathymetric isolines. Prime meridians: Greenwich and Washington. Shows California/Nevada border as irregular, following the Sierra Nevada Mountains ; Arizona below New Mexico with an unhighlighted border ; and county borders extending beyond state boundaries. Includes rivers, roads, towns, and locations of Native American tribes. Numbered 54 and 55. From "Johnson's New illustrated (steel plate) family atlas ... / compiled, drawn, and engraved under the supervision of J.H. Colton and A.J. Johnson. New York, Johnson & Browning." 1 map : hand col. ; 42 x 62 cm. This map is in the public domain. Please attribute access and use of this digitized map to the Stephen S. Clark Library, University of Michigan Library.
